title: £800,000 Hopper Bus plans scrapped
text:
The hopper buses from 199 Politicians have scrapped plans for a new town centre bus service in Jersey.
The Hopper service would have linked up the outer edges of St Helier to the town centre, but the Minister for Transport and Technical Services says it is would not be worth the £800,000 price tag.
Deputy Eddie Noel says he is concerned people would not use the service - as already happens to others in the island.
Instead, he proposes a volunteer-led service.
Play video Before it was introduced everybody said yes that's a great idea, it's something that we want. And then you put it in place and nobody uses it.
It's similar with a new bus service. I think it's the number 14 that goes from St John's all the way to Les Quennevais, via St Peters. It's not being utilised that much at the moment. It's something that people asked for, that's been provided, but it's not being used so we have to make sure that whatever we put into town - because it will be expensive even with volunteer drivers - has to be used.
– Deputy Eddie Noel, Technical Services Minister Last updated Wed 16 Sep 2015 Travel Jersey
